Patient: I hate my new diet. I'm on a dash diet and a low salt diet. I don't even know what to eat because all these stupid rules, and I don't wanna screw up my kidneys ferrous. So what do I do?

Nurse: I understand that it can be challenging to adjust to new dietary guidelines. It's great that you're committed to protecting your kidney health. Would it be okay if I shared some suggestions that might make it easier for you to follow your diet?

Patient: Yeah.

Nurse: Wonderful. For your DASH diet, it's about eating a variety of nutrient-rich foods. This includes fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats. It's also about limiting foods high in saturated fats, such as fatty meats and full-fat dairy products. For your sodium-limited diet, it's about choosing foods that are naturally low in sodium and avoiding those that are high in sodium, like processed foods. It's also about using herbs and spices to flavor your food instead of salt. Does this help?

Patient: I guess.
